english: he falls (from a form of existence), he dies
he lives (is alive, makes a living)
non-human being (i.e. a god, etc.) (negative prefix a)
priest, brahmin (member of the hereditary priesthood)
god (usual meaning), king (as term of respectful address)
warrior, noble (member of the military-aristocratic class)
a time, occasion (any time, time of an event)
thus-gone (from worldliness to a state of calm: epithet of the Buddha (usually) or of others like him)
lay disciple, the lay disciple, a lay disciple
goal, prosperity, wealth, welfare, purpose, meaning, subject-matter
(true, natural) doctrine, natural element, natural substance, natural phenomenon
"the fortunate", "the bountiful", "the Master" (translations vary: "the blessed one", "the exalted one", etc.)
"God" (the supreme being and creator in the Brahmanical religion of the hereditary priesthood of India)
he holds, he wears, he has, he accepts (with two patients /accusatives: x as y), he remembers
he salutes, he greets, he takes leave
he untwists, he unravels, he explains, he rebuts
he feels, he experiences (something to be something)
life, way of life, dwelling (also used figuratively of a mental state, e.g., of happiness)
and (always follows the word it connects, or the first word of a phrase it connects called therefore an "enclitic" or "postpositive"
by name (used after the name) (sometimes merely emphatic, "indeed")
high priest, (approx.) prime minister (the priest who is chief adviser to the king, "instructing": anu-sās, him in both secular matters and religious duties)
he goes from, he goes away (poetic)
also, too (like ca this follows the word, or the first word of the phrase, connected by it)
great king, king (nom. sg. as rājan-, but rest follows a declension on stem -rāja-, e.g.: acc. mahārājaṃ. The nom. pl. may be written either ~ā or ~āno)
cessation (of unhappiness and of perception, sensation and mental states), peace of mind, calm
it may be, may it be, it shall be.
he attains, he arrives (a rare, "poetic" verb; cf. in ordinary speech phusati and upasaṃkamati)
he can, he is able to
he advises, he instructs (used especially of ministers of a king, also figuratively of a teacher)
he comes (the vowels combine: only the context can decide whether the meaning is "goes" or "comes")
he eats, he bites, he chews
course (lit, and fig., including discourse and manner of doing something)
having done; karitvā is also used
having become separated from, having become isolated
having taken (often equivalent to simply "taking" in English)
speaking, saying (p.p. of bhās used as a noun)
living being (p.p. of bhū used as a noun)
he conquers, he wins, he defeats
excellent, splendid!, it's lucky, it's wonderful
surely, indeed! (strong emphasis or mild expletive, expressing a wish, regret, reproach or surprise: cf. "alas!", "I say!")
it is done (the i may be long or short; another spelling is kayirati)
it is said, it is called (cf. the past participle: vutta)
sir! (polite address to a Buddhist monk)
it is true that, is it true that? (whether this is interrogative can appear only from the context and intonation)
or, either (enclitic, used like ca in Vocabulary section of Part 4)
he will be, there will be
he deserves, he must, he ought
for a long time, after a long time
body (of a man or animal: kāyo has this sense but also the wider meanings of "substance", "particle"), the plural sarīrāni is used to mean "(bodily) relics" (of the Buddha after his cremation)
he is born (intransitive verb; stem irregularly formed)
he takes (irregular elision of root vowel, cf. passive conjugation; here i)
he acquires, he produces, he gets, he has (intransitive in the latter meaning)
he engages in, he follows, he practises, he behaves (habitually)
it happens, it arises, it becomes
it is, it occurs, it is found (to be the case)
transmigrated, reborn, arisen, come into existence
(whence then? - rhetorical question): much less, let alone
thence, then, from there, from that
sir! (polite address between equals, also to juniors)
it pleases, it suits, he approves, he likes (dative of person)
? (enclitic: an interrogative particle reinforcing an interrogative pronoun or combined with another indeclinable to make it interrogative: nanu,"(is) not?"; or by itself = "does?")
then, so, now (accusative of ta(d) used adverbially)
